Siref nodded"Sure don't take too long."

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Blackfang gets the orders and rises besides Siref.
> 
> Blackfang: Sure thing, Talos. I'm on my way. By the way, call me 
> Blackfang. (Then to Siref) Sorry, Siref, Talos needs me. I'll try to 
> get back fast, but I don't want to promise anything.
> 
> He heads back to the mess hall, where he assumes Talos is.
> 
> Blackfang: Unit Blackfang ready for action, sir!
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> > > He goes looking for Talos.
> > >
> > 
> > {Talos}
> > Mess Hall
> > 
> >     Things were looking better in the mess hall, the salvagable 
> chairs and
> > tables were upright and the bar unit and energon stores were 
alright 
> for the
> > moment, but they'd need to begin searching for reserves soon. By 
now 
> the
> > reports of the communications repairs had filtered in as well as 
> reports of
> > the sensor enhancment to the north.
> > 
> >     Looking around he nodded to those present and made his way 
back 
> to the
> > bridge. The first day of the new beast wars had gone smoothly with 
> only a
> > few minor problems left to deal with. First were the two younger 
> bots on
> > board, he had no idea how they got there, this wasn't a passenger 
> ship but
> > the fact of the matter they were here and that meant they had to 
be 
> included
> > in the mission.
> > 
> >     As he walked onto the bridge nodding to Sunhawk since he 
seemed 
> to be
> > looking for him he took his chair and turned to regard the 
> leutenient even
> > as he played over the second issue in his thoughts, Sunhawk was a 
> wanted
> > felon. He knew it and Sunhawk knew it. However he was willing to 
> give any
> > bot, no matter the tarnish on his or her record, an opportunity to 
> prove
> > themselves. He held no doubts that Sunhawk would be taken into 
> custody by
> > the port officials when the mission was done with, but depending 
on 
> how the
> > bot held himself during this mission would decide wether or not 
he'd 
> have
> > Talos' good word put in for him.
> > 
> >     Turning he noticed one of the consoles blinking, turning 
> distracted from
> > his thoughts and Sunhawks report as he investigated. A weak signal 
> was being
> > caught by the new arrays dish. It seemed like an outdated distress 
> beacon
> > signal and maximal in design, but this algorithim hadn't been used
> > since...the original beast wars.
> > 
> >     Talos rose shaking his head, impossible. There's no way one of 
> Primals
> > crew could still be here could there? He couldn't chance it. 
> Pressing a
> > button on the comm he spoke, "Hot Rod, Blackknight, report to the 
> bridge for
> > new orders." Sitting back in his chair he turned back to regard 
> Sunhawk.
